main event: On 30th March 1950, an unidentified flying object was observed by three stockyard employees in Sioux City, Iowa, for about 15-20 minutes. The object appeared to be silver in color, about the size of a plane at high altitudes, and was moving slowly at an estimated altitude of 20,000 feet.
interesting points: The object was observed through field glasses and appeared to have a metallic sheen or silver color.
It was described as moving slowly with no discernible maneuverability.
No sound or exhaust trail was observed, and the weather at the time was clear with 15 miles visibility.
The report is part of Project Blue Book and contains information on alleged sightings of unidentified flying objects/phenomena.
The sightings occurred in the US during March 1950 and were reported by various USAF Pilots Service Center units.
